abstract: Deliberations are set to resume in case against Massey Energy Co chief executive Donald L Blankenship after Federal Judge Irene C Berger refuses to declare mistrial; Blankenship is accused of safety violations after 29 employees were killed in company mine in 2010.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge refused to declare a mistrial in the case of Donald L. Blankenship, the chief executive of Massey Energy Company when 29 mine workers were killed in 2010.

headline.main: West Virginia: Mistrial Request Refused in Mine Case
headline.print_headline: West Virginia: Mistrial Request Refused in Mine Case

snippet: A federal judge refused to declare a mistrial in the case of Donald L. Blankenship, the chief executive of Massey Energy Company when 29 mine workers were killed in 2010.
